reviews.sentence: AH MAZING. amazing. just like every W hotel the service and comfort of the hotel was great.

Really trendy place where the younger crowd likes to congregate. The bar scene is a happening place with fast attentive service. The rooms had a really cool vibe to it and it provided us a great view of the city. The holidays and new year it can quickly overbok so get your reservations in early.

Disappointing. The staff at the front desk was nice. They were friendly and welcoming. Bar staff were moderate. The room never seemed superb. The view was not at all what I thought I was paying for. And there was a dj turn table at Sunday brunch a bit weird. For what we paid I thought it was going to be something a little nicer.

BEST STAYCATION EVER. THE W IS THE VIRGIN AMERICA OF AIRLINES HIP MODERN AND RELAXING. Wow. My favorite San Francisco hotel is The Clift. Me and a friend were attending an adult prom event at The W hotel so we thought why not stay here too. Well it was the best decision I made. I was honored a AAA rate at 186 for a King Size room and it was worth every penny. The parking is worth the 50 because of convenience and hassle free parking and peace of mind safety. So the W insider Sara Hamza reaches out before our stay just to make sure we are in the know and have plans set. The night before our stay I needed to figure out dinner reservations and did not have time to call each restaurant and had to put in someone elses hands Sara came through very quickly with restaurant options 4 stars and up and times. I chose Slanted Door and a time and Wah Lah done. Check in was a breeze room was upgraded think because I was a Starwod Preferred Guest. so sign up. I felt as if I could live in the room. All amenities were appreciated. Check out is 12 pm which that extra hour I wish I could have taken advantage of next time. FYI they have a Pac Man arcade game right near the bar. I love this hotel. This is my go to if I am ever in this part of San Francisco again. Keep up the good work W.

Nice hotel in the middle of the big city. From check in to check out I had a great experience hotel staff was there when you needed them and not in your face when you did not. I had a pleasant experience and next time I go to the city I will probably stay at the W depending on the activities I will be doing. The beds were almost too comfortable I did not want to get out of bed. But seriously I was sleeping on a cloud. Go to pier 39 and fishermans warf drive the little yellow cars around GoCar and explore the city. Ignore the homeless people. Nothing comes to mind.

Must stay at The W. Really nice staff complimentary car service in the city limit is saved on uber taxi rate included breakfast which was amazing. Great location fantastic views from the room. Room was clean and quietlok forward to coming back next time I am in San Francisco. The deposit for the room. But its hotel policy.

My girlfriend and I stayed there one evening and two days I do not think my experience was long enough for a conscientious review but I will give you a little bit of my likes and dislikes. The room was on the small side but comfortable and had plenty of amenities. The clock radio with USB charger and Bluetoth sounded pretty good for it size. The staff was extremely friendly and attentive. My girlfriend like the toiletries the bath robes and the bath towels. She also liked the little bench underneath the window. I did not like the firm pillows. The bed was not really to my liking and the thermostat did not seem to keep a constant comfortable temperature. I was also disappointed that the TV was mounted and could not swivel and did not have a HDMI port for connectivity of external devices. But we did like the hotel and we will be back.

Small Room. Best Staff. The staff here is absolutely the most friendly I have ever encountered. Especially Ruben. The rooms are a little small. at least mine was. I am sure there all different room styles that are bigger. Comfortable beds cool atmosphere.

The location was a wonderful environment for our event. The service was top notch the set up professional and condusive to networking. The location was central for our purposes. The room acoustics and acesivility from other floors could have been a bit better.

Great location your standard room for its class. We however encountered a quite difficult situation. We were on a road trip coming from the Grand Canyon area and ended up checking in at the said hotel circa 3 am. The staff at the reception offered to “ upgrade ” us to a better room with one bigger sized bed plus a movable mattress bed. Note that we had booked and paid for a room for three people sleeping on two double beds. The way we were proposed the upgrade seemed a better deal than the one we paid and therefore we agreed to the hotel ’s offer. Probably it was our mistake to deem that the offer would include the new bigger bed in place of the one of two paid doubles the other paid double bed and a bonus matres bed which indeed did nt make sense. We anyway did n’t question much since this was presented as an upgrade. Arriving to the room we realised that three people had to share one big bed or could ask for an additional foldable mattress bed as was the offer. Having deemed this as unacceptable we returned to the reception only to be told that we have been offered this “ upgrade ” to which we supposedly agreed to. It took plenty of discussion with the reception in the presence of the member of the security staff for the reception staff to call in the duty manager after we underlined that the upgrade we were offered was actually a downgrade. The manager was indeed extremely polite and offered one extra room to solve the issue. Despite the positive end to the night the whole incident was unecerary especially given the time and our tiredness and indeed unacceptable for a hotel of the class of W Overboking or whatever else the reason a hotel of such class owes to fully respect its guests and their trust in its business.

AWFUL. There was a union strike during the days I stayed at the W San Francisco. While I understand the hotel has no control over these type of situations but they have control on how to WOW their guests which did not happen to me while I was there. The room rate was 405night. Asked if they can discount it they refused to. But they expect you to stay at the hotel with less or NO service at all. My bathroom floor was sticky hair was all over the place and I have to go down to the front desk to get a towel shampoo conditioner soap coffee puds etc. I should just have stayed at a Motel 6 I am sure I would have received a far better service there. NOT COOL W San Francisco.

Place was nice but they need to negotiate w their employees and end strike. They did n’t tell me their employees were on strike1. I felt bad crossing the picket line EVERY SINGLE TIME I WALKED OUTSIDE. 2. Although sympathetic I did not expect to be greeted with blast phones and people chanting “ check out get a refund ”.
Terrible on straik no service very poor.

So disappointed. Stayed at this W for the first time a few weeks ago for a work trip. Received my final bill 3 days after check out with an erroneous 78 honor bar charge. Called W to dispute it as I did not consume anything from the honor bar. W dismissed the claim saying the attendants word was that they replenished a bottle of bourbon is held in higher regard than the customers and refused to reverse the charge. I do not drink bourbon if they claimed it was a bottle of red wine it might have been believable. Needless to say I am disappointed that I am out of 78 I did not spend and the W could not make good on it. Will not be staying at this hotel again.

Overpriced Location close to Moscone. Everything else was horrible. Wet ceiling so during showers our stuff got super wet. TV turned on itself in the middle of the night with “ No Signal ” waking us up. Hair dryer blown with cold air staff replaced it with 100 non working one and only third attempt was successful. In general overpriced place.

I was there tonight for Valentine ’s party with one of my friends. Before we leave the bar we were having hot water to freshen our throat a d having a job and interview related conversation with a guy. I felt he is very strange tgat ’s Why when he asked me where I live I did n’t tell him he repeat his question 3 times. Then when he got disappointed he insulted me and said f words to me. when I asked W Hotel ’s security to throw him out of there They did n’t do it. Then when I left the place I realized That I forgot to get my credit card back as I opened a bar. Then when I called them the security told me that based on their “ protocols ” they can not throw anyone out while they ’re having a drink in their hands. Guess what. Someone can insult a lady in W Hotel and say F words to her but still enjoy his time because he ’s having a drink in his hand. They do n’t respect ladies because of a glass of alcohol. Their policy is all about making money with zero customer service PS 1. I should not forget to mention that bartenders throw our drinks away as we were dancing for 2 minutes. 2. After I called them for my credit card they first said they can not find it. And after few minutes they told me ut ’s here —. it was my first time in W hotel and last time as they make me feel insecure and nor respected Yes guys their “ protocol ” is very special. you can not underestand it unles you are able to insult people and say f words to them.

This hotel is overpriced for the services given. The check in was slow and receptionist snobby and cold. I felt like I was in a disco with the loud music and flashing lights which is part of the ambience and decor. This was definitely not what I was looking for after a long day at meetings. The convince of the hotel next to the convention centre and nespreso in the room are the only two reasons I give it three stars.

Decent Choice in San Fran. Stayed here for 3 nights on a girls trip. It is well located in San Francisco. The service personnel at the hotel are terrific. Many have been working there for a decade and they are very friendly accommodating and knowledgable. The food and beverage is top class. Our room was sufficient small but sufficient. They are currently undergoing a major construction which they did not tell us about when booking the entire building vibrates and there is a machine noise starting at 9AM every morning. On my check out morning they shut off the water in the hotel from 9A1P and I found out about it the night before so I had to wake up early and make sure I could shower before the shut down. Crazy that they give you no real warning of the state of the hotel. I do not know how long this construction period will be for but you should check before you stay there during it. I also selected this hotel because there was a business center. There is not a business center. There is a small hallway alcove on the 3rd floor right next to the staff toilets with two mostly broken printers no office accoutrements and rickety computers you can not print from your own laptop. just embarrassing setup for business travelers. Anyway it is a good hotel just has some rough patches.

The place is very centrist and you can go anywhere around there. The hotel average night is about 400. I bet you can expect a great customer service but the reality is different once you are there. The front desk staff is not that friendly. As I was walking into the hotel with luggage nobody open the door for me an my 2 luggage I have with me and then the front desk experience was not friendly at all. The only good experience I had with staff was the room service and the servers during the meals all of them were very detail oriented. Food was really good 100 and with lots of options nut free vegan vegetarian etc etc.

Outstanding service at the restaurant. Had two experiences one being standard good service and the other one being excellent. Damian who is worked in that restaurant for years as he later told me goes above and beyond when it comes to serving his patrons. He would not let me stand at the front desk even though I arrived for breakfast a couple minutes early which I did not know he is always got a warm smile for everyone and he is got the gift to magically make even the grumpies jetlaged guest me feel happy and smile. Thank you Damian.

People at front desk need to be retrained. They were not active listening and their stern faces made it uncomfortable to talk to them especially two Asian males service representatives at the front desk.

W in San Fran maybe maybe not. The cons Our toilet did not work very well wifi was not free room service kept forgetting stuff and had to go back and forth a few times before we got everything we ordered and took a few flushes before toilet would finally flush. Pros Was pleasantly surprised by free brunch both days very clean and posh rooms and parking available on site.

Best Hotel in San Francisco. I ’m really impressed with the quality of customer service we received at this gorgeous hotel. Despite the fact that I had employee discount and did n’t know anyone at this hotel. I was never treated with less curtesy or less effort to make my stay memorable. It makes me think that if an employee is treated with such great service how would a regular customer will be treated. I can only imagine it will be out this world. The room was comfortable well kept and very clean. The food was amazingly delicious all five times we ordered room service.
